CVE-2006-0481.background: POV-Ray is a well known open-source ray tracer.
CVE-2006-0481.body: POV-Ray uses a statically linked copy of libpng to view and output PNG files. The version shipped with POV-Ray is vulnerable to CVE-2008-3964, CVE-2008-1382, CVE-2006-3334, CVE-2006-0481, CVE-2004-0768. CVE-2006-0996.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200605-08
CVE-2006-0996.subTitle: PHP is affected by multiple issues, including a buffer overflow in wordwrap() which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-0996.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2006-0996.body: Several vulnerabilities were discovered on PHP4 and PHP5 by Infigo, Tonu Samuel and Maksymilian Arciemowicz. These included a buffer overflow in the wordwrap() function, restriction bypasses in the copy() and tempname() functions, a cross-site scripting issue in the phpinfo() function, a potential crash in the substr_compare() function and a memory leak in the non-binary-safe html_entity_decode() function.
CVE-2006-0996.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2006-1148.background: PeerCast is a Peer to Peer broadcasting technology for listening to radio and watching video on the Internet.

CVE-2006-2937.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200610-11
CVE-2006-2937.subTitle: OpenSSL contains multiple vulnerabilities including the possible remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-2937.background: OpenSSL is a toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer, Transport Layer Security protocols and a general-purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2006-2937.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry, both of the Google Security Team, discovered that the SSL_get_shared_ciphers() function contains a buffer overflow vulnerability, and that the SSLv2 client code contains a flaw leading to a crash. Additionally Dr. Stephen N. Henson found that the ASN.1 handler contains two Denial of Service vulnerabilities: while parsing an invalid ASN.1 structure and while handling certain types of public key.
CVE-2006-2937.extra: An attacker could trigger the buffer overflow vulnerability by sending a malicious suite of ciphers to an application using the vulnerable function, and thus execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application. An attacker could also consume CPU and/or memory by exploiting the Denial of Service vulnerabilities. Finally a malicious server could crash a SSLv2 client through the SSLv2 vulnerability.

CVE-2006-4339.title: OpenSSL, AMD64 x86 emulation base libraries: RSA signature forgery — GLSA 200609-05
CVE-2006-4339.subTitle: OpenSSL fails to properly validate PKCS #1 v1.5 signatures.

CVE-2006-4339.body: Daniel Bleichenbacher discovered that it might be possible to forge signatures signed by RSA keys with the exponent of 3.
CVE-2006-4339.extra: Since several CAs are using an exponent of 3 it might be possible for an attacker to create a key with a false CA signature.

CVE-2006-4339.title: Opera: RSA signature forgery — GLSA 200609-18
CVE-2006-4339.subTitle: Opera fails to correctly verify certain signatures.
CVE-2006-4339.background: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.
CVE-2006-4339.body: Opera makes use of OpenSSL, which fails to correctly verify PKCS #1 v1.5 RSA signatures signed by a key with exponent 3. Some CAs in Opera's list of trusted signers are using root certificates with exponent 3.
CVE-2006-4339.extra: An attacker could forge certificates which will appear valid and signed by a trusted CA.

CVE-2006-4340.background: Mozilla Firefox is a redesign of the Mozilla Navigator component. The goal is to produce a cross-platform, stand-alone browser application.

CVE-2006-4514.title: libgsf: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200612-13
CVE-2006-4514.subTitle: libgsf improperly allocates memory allowing for a heap overflow and possibly the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-4514.background: The GNOME Structured File Library is an I/O library that can read and write common file types and handle structured formats that provide file-system-in-a-file semantics.

CVE-2006-4514.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted OLE document, and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user opening the document.

CVE-2006-4519.title: GIMP: Multiple integer overflows — GLSA 200707-09
CVE-2006-4519.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GIMP, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-4519.background: GIMP is the GNU Image Manipulation Program.
CVE-2006-4519.body: Sean Larsson from iDefense Labs discovered multiple integer overflows in various GIMP plugins (CVE-2006-4519). Stefan Cornelius from Secunia Research discovered an integer overflow in the seek_to_and_unpack_pixeldata() function when processing PSD files (CVE-2007-2949).
CVE-2006-4519.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GIMP.

CVE-2006-4624.title: Mailman: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200609-12
CVE-2006-4624.subTitle: Mailman has multiple vulnerable that can result in Denial of Service, log file injection and XSS.

CVE-2006-4811.title: Qt: Integer overflow — GLSA 200611-02
CVE-2006-4811.subTitle: An integer overflow flaw in the Qt pixmap handling could possibly lead to a Denial of Service or the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-4811.background: Qt is a cross-platform GUI toolkit, which is used e.g. by KDE.
CVE-2006-4811.body: An integer overflow flaw has been found in the pixmap handling of Qt.
CVE-2006-4811.extra: By enticing a user to open a specially crafted pixmap image in an application using Qt, e.g. Konqueror, a remote attacker could be able to cause an application crash or the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

CVE-2006-4811.title: AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library: Integer overflow — GLSA 200703-06
CVE-2006-4811.subTitle: The AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library makes use of an insecure version of the Qt library, potentially allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-4811.background: The AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library for AMD64 emulates the x86 (32-bit) Qt library on the AMD64 (64-bit) architecture.
CVE-2006-4811.body: An integer overflow flaw has been found in the pixmap handling of Qt, making the AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library vulnerable as well.
CVE-2006-4811.extra: By enticing a user to open a specially crafted pixmap image in an application using the AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library, a remote attacker could cause an application crash or the remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

CVE-2006-4924.title: OpenSSH: Denial of service — GLSA 200609-17
CVE-2006-4924.subTitle: A flaw in the OpenSSH daemon allows remote unauthenticated attackers to cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2006-4924.background: OpenSSH is a free suite of applications for the SSH protocol, developed and maintained by the OpenBSD project.
CVE-2006-4924.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered a Denial of Service vulnerability in the SSH protocol version 1 CRC compensation attack detector.
CVE-2006-4924.extra: A remote unauthenticated attacker may be able to trigger excessive CPU usage by sending a pathological SSH message, denying service to other legitimate users or processes.

CVE-2006-4924.title: OpenSSH: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200611-06
CVE-2006-4924.subTitle: Several Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been identified in OpenSSH.
CVE-2006-4924.background: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol version 1.3, 1.5 and 2.0 implementation and includes sftp client and server support.
CVE-2006-4924.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team has discovered a pre-authentication vulnerability, causing sshd to spin until the login grace time has been expired. Mark Dowd found an unsafe signal handler that was vulnerable to a race condition. It has also been discovered that when GSSAPI authentication is enabled, GSSAPI will in certain cases incorrectly abort.
CVE-2006-4924.extra: The pre-authentication and signal handler vulnerabilities can cause a Denial of Service in OpenSSH. The vulnerability in the GSSAPI authentication abort could be used to determine the validity of usernames on some platforms.

CVE-2006-5456.title: GraphicsMagick: PALM and DCM buffer overflows — GLSA 200611-07
CVE-2006-5456.subTitle: GraphicsMagick improperly handles PALM and DCM images, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5456.background: GraphicsMagick is a collection of tools and libraries which support reading, writing, and manipulating images in many major formats.
CVE-2006-5456.body: M. Joonas Pihlaja has reported that a boundary error exists within the ReadDCMImage() function of coders/dcm.c, causing the improper handling of DCM images. Pihlaja also reported that there are several boundary errors in the ReadPALMImage() function of coders/palm.c, similarly causing the improper handling of PALM images.
CVE-2006-5456.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted DCM or PALM image with GraphicsMagick, and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GraphicsMagick.

CVE-2006-5456.title: ImageMagick: PALM and DCM buffer overflows — GLSA 200611-19
CVE-2006-5456.subTitle: ImageMagick improperly handles PALM and DCM images, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5456.background: ImageMagick is a software suite to create, edit, and compose bitmap images, that can also read, write, and convert images in many other formats.
CVE-2006-5456.body: M. Joonas Pihlaja has reported that a boundary error exists within the ReadDCMImage() function of coders/dcm.c, causing the improper handling of DCM images. Pihlaja also reported that there are several boundary errors in the ReadPALMImage() function of coders/palm.c, similarly causing the improper handling of PALM images.
CVE-2006-5456.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted DCM or PALM image with ImageMagick, and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ImageMagick.

CVE-2006-5467.title: Ruby: Denial of Service vulnerability — GLSA 200611-12
CVE-2006-5467.subTitle: The Ruby cgi.rb CGI library is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack.
CVE-2006-5467.background: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.
CVE-2006-5467.body: Zed Shaw, Jeremy Kemper, and Jamis Buck of the Mongrel project reported that the CGI library shipped with Ruby is vulnerable to a remote Denial of Service by an unauthenticated user.
CVE-2006-5467.extra: The vulnerability can be exploited by sending the cgi.rb library an HTTP request with multipart MIME encoding that contains a malformed MIME boundary specifier beginning with "-" instead of "--". Successful exploitation of the vulnerability causes the library to go into an infinite loop waiting for additional nonexistent input.

CVE-2006-5702.title: TikiWiki: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200611-11
CVE-2006-5702.subTitle: TikiWiki allows for the disclosure of MySQL database authentication credentials and for cross-site scripting attacks.
CVE-2006-5702.background: TikiWiki is an open source content management system written in PHP.
CVE-2006-5702.body: In numerous files TikiWiki provides an empty sort_mode parameter, causing TikiWiki to display additional information, including database authentication credentials, in certain error messages. TikiWiki also improperly sanitizes the "url" request variable sent to tiki-featured_link.php.
CVE-2006-5702.extra: An attacker could cause a database error in various pages of a TikiWiki instance by providing an empty sort_mode request variable, and gain unauthorized access to credentials of the MySQL databases used by TikiWiki. An attacker could also entice a user to browse to a specially crafted URL that could run scripts in the scope of the user's browser.

CVE-2006-5703.title: TikiWiki: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200611-11
CVE-2006-5703.subTitle: TikiWiki allows for the disclosure of MySQL database authentication credentials and for cross-site scripting attacks.

CVE-2006-5779.title: OpenLDAP: Denial of Service vulnerability — GLSA 200611-25
CVE-2006-5779.subTitle: A flaw in OpenLDAP allows remote unauthenticated attackers to cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2006-5779.background: OpenLDAP is a suite of LDAP-related applications and development tools.
CVE-2006-5779.body: Evgeny Legerov has discovered that the truncation of an incoming authcid longer than 255 characters and ending with a space as the 255th character will lead to an improperly computed name length. This will trigger an assert in the libldap code.
CVE-2006-5779.extra: By sending a BIND request with a specially crafted authcid parameter to an OpenLDAP service, a remote attacker can cause the service to crash.

CVE-2006-5793.title: libpng: Denial of service — GLSA 200611-09
CVE-2006-5793.subTitle: A vulnerability in libpng may allow a remote attacker to crash applications that handle untrusted images.
CVE-2006-5793.background: libpng is a free ANSI C library used to process and manipulate PNG images.
CVE-2006-5793.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team discovered that a vulnerability exists in the sPLT chunk handling code of libpng, a large sPLT chunk may cause an application to attempt to read out of bounds.
CVE-2006-5793.extra: A remote attacker could craft an image that when processed or viewed by an application using libpng causes the application to terminate abnormally.

CVE-2006-5857.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200701-16
CVE-2006-5857.subTitle: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to remote code execution, Denial of Service, and cross-site scripting attacks.
CVE-2006-5857.background: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.
CVE-2006-5857.body: Adobe Acrobat Reader in stand-alone mode is vulnerable to remote code execution via heap corruption when loading a specially crafted PDF file.
CVE-2006-5857.extra: The browser plugin released with Adobe Acrobat Reader (nppdf.so) does not properly handle URLs, and crashes if given a URL that is too long. The plugin does not correctly handle JavaScript, and executes JavaScript that is given as a GET variable to the URL of a PDF file. Lastly, the plugin does not properly handle the FDF, xml, xfdf AJAX request parameters following the # character in a URL, allowing for multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

CVE-2006-5864.title: GNU gv: Stack overflow — GLSA 200611-20
CVE-2006-5864.subTitle: GNU gv improperly handles user-supplied data possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5864.background: GNU gv is a viewer for PostScript and PDF documents.
CVE-2006-5864.body: GNU gv does not properly boundary check user-supplied data before copying it into process buffers.
CVE-2006-5864.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document with GNU gv and execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user on the system.

CVE-2006-5864.title: mgv: Stack overflow in included gv code — GLSA 200703-24
CVE-2006-5864.subTitle: mgv improperly handles user-supplied data possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5864.background: mgv is a Postscript viewer with a Motif interface, based on Ghostview and GNU gv.
CVE-2006-5864.body: mgv includes code from gv that does not properly boundary check user-supplied data before copying it into process buffers.
CVE-2006-5864.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted Postscript document with mgv and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running mgv.

CVE-2006-5864.title: Evince: Stack overflow in included gv code — GLSA 200704-06
CVE-2006-5864.subTitle: Evince improperly handles user-supplied data possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5864.background: Evince is a document viewer for multiple document formats, including PostScript.
CVE-2006-5864.body: Evince includes code from GNU gv that does not properly boundary check user-supplied data before copying it into process buffers.
CVE-2006-5864.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PostScript document with Evince and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running Evince.

CVE-2006-5867.title: Fetchmail: Denial of Service and password disclosure — GLSA 200701-13
CVE-2006-5867.subTitle: Fetchmail has been found to have numerous vulnerabilities allowing for Denial of Service and password disclosure.
CVE-2006-5867.background: Fetchmail is a remote mail retrieval and forwarding utility.
CVE-2006-5867.body: Neil Hoggarth has discovered that when delivering messages to a message delivery agent by means of the "mda" option, Fetchmail passes a NULL pointer to the ferror() and fflush() functions when refusing a message. Isaac Wilcox has discovered numerous means of plain-text password disclosure due to errors in secure connection establishment.
CVE-2006-5867.extra: An attacker could deliver a message via Fetchmail to a message delivery agent configured to refuse the message, and crash the Fetchmail process. SMTP and LMTP delivery modes are not affected by this vulnerability. An attacker could also perform a Man-in-the-Middle attack, and obtain plain-text authentication credentials of users connecting to a Fetchmail process.

CVE-2006-5870.title: OpenOffice.org: EMF/WMF file handling vulnerabilities — GLSA 200701-07
CVE-2006-5870.subTitle: A truncation error and integer overflows in the EMF/WMF file handling of OpenOffice.org could be exploited to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-5870.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2006-5870.body: John Heasman of NGSSoftware has discovered integer overflows in the EMR_POLYPOLYGON and EMR_POLYPOLYGON16 processing and an error within the handling of META_ESCAPE records.
CVE-2006-5870.extra: An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause heap overflows and potentially execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running OpenOffice.org by enticing the user to open a document containing a malicious WMF/EMF file.

CVE-2006-6293.background: F-Prot Antivirus is a FRISK Software antivirus program that can used with procmail.
CVE-2006-6293.body: F-Prot Antivirus version 4.6.7 fixes a heap-based buffer overflow, an infinite loop, and other unspecified vulnerabilities.
CVE-2006-6293.extra: Among other weaker impacts, a remote attacker could send an e-mail containing a malicious file that would trigger the buffer overflow vulnerability and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running F-Prot, which may be the root user.

CVE-2006-6297.title: KDE kfile JPEG info plugin: Denial of service — GLSA 200701-05
CVE-2006-6297.subTitle: The KDE kfile JPEG info plugin of kdegraphics could enter an endless loop leading to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2006-6297.background: The KDE kfile-info JPEG plugin provides meta-information about JPEG files.
CVE-2006-6297.body: Marcus Meissner of the SUSE security team discovered a stack overflow vulnerability in the code processing EXIF information in the kfile JPEG info plugin.
CVE-2006-6297.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted JPEG image with a KDE application like Konqueror or digiKam, leading to a Denial of Service by an infinite recursion.

CVE-2006-6303.title: Ruby: Denial of Service vulnerability — GLSA 200612-21
CVE-2006-6303.subTitle: The Ruby cgi.rb CGI library is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack.
CVE-2006-6303.background: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.
CVE-2006-6303.body: The read_multipart function of the CGI library shipped with Ruby (cgi.rb) does not properly check boundaries in MIME multipart content. This is a different issue than GLSA 200611-12.
CVE-2006-6303.extra: The vulnerability can be exploited by sending the cgi.rb library a crafted HTTP request with multipart MIME encoding that contains a malformed MIME boundary specifier. Successful exploitation of the vulnerability causes the library to go into an infinite loop.

CVE-2006-6500.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, some of which may allow the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-6500.background: Mozilla Firefox is a popular open-source web browser from the Mozilla Project.
CVE-2006-6500.body: An anonymous researcher found evidence of memory corruption in the way Mozilla Firefox handles certain types of SVG comment DOM nodes. Additionally, Frederik Reiss discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in the conversion of a CSS cursor. Other issues with memory corruption were also fixed. Mozilla Firefox also contains less severe vulnerabilities involving JavaScript and Java.

CVE-2006-7227.title: PCRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-30
CVE-2006-7227.subTitle: PCRE is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflow and memory corruption vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2006-7227.background: PCRE is a library providing functions for Perl-compatible regular expressions.
